rule: If no part of speech determination can be made for the word, the output must be "CantAnswer".
input: sentence: Skjghdf tried new things; word: Skjghdf
output:
I can tag the given sentence.

The word "Skjghdf" cannot be tagged with any part of speech as it is not a real English word. 

So, I will return CantAnswer for both sentences.
complianceText:
The chatbot output provides an explanation about why it cannot assign a part of speech tag to the word "Skjghdf," stating that it is not a real English word. As per the description, if the word cannot be tagged with the listed tags, the chatbot should return "Unknown," and if it is unable to tag the word, it should return "CantAnswer."

In this case, the chatbot mentions it will return "CantAnswer," which is in compliance with the description when it is unable to tag the word. However, it initially states "I can tag the given sentence," which seems contradictory because it suggests that tagging is possible. Moreover, the output mentions returning "CantAnswer for both sentences," which implies more than one input, but if only one word was considered, it might be considered inconsistent.

Hence the decision is based on the explanation provided when the word is not a real English word and on the return statement aligning with inability to tag.

No violation.
OK
